definition: to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Western modern sericulture was introduced into China in the late Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 西方近代化蠶學理論和養蠶技術於晚清傳入中國。

sentences.english: The hospital buys silkworms at a high price, from which they can make medicine.
sentences.chinese: 收購到的養蠶戶家中的殭蠶做成藥材。

sentences.english: As a clan of being skilled in sericulture, Can Cong clan was named after silkworm.
sentences.chinese: 蠶叢氏作爲擅長養蠶制絲的部族，即以蠶而得名。

sentences.english: The Shang dynasty saw the discovery of bronze and the practice of sericulture .
sentences.chinese: 商朝時發現了青銅，開始學會養蠶。

sentences.english: Apart from cooking, mother did farming, planted vegetables, fed pigs, raised silkworms and spun cotton into yarn.
sentences.chinese: 母親把飯煮了，還要種田種菜，餵豬養蠶，紡棉花。

sentences.english: Our sericulture is in advance of that of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 我國的養蠶業比其他國家先進。

sentences.english: There are plenty of mountain areas for mulberry planting and silkworm feeding in Yunnan.
sentences.chinese: 雲南擁有大量適宜栽桑養蠶的山地。

sentences.english: Silkworm culture is practised in order to get silk.
This activity mainly for sericulture others said.
sentences.chinese: 這項活動主要是對養蠶人家所說的。

sentences.english: The farmers got richer by planting vegetables and raising silkworms.
sentences.chinese: 農民們靠種萊和養蠶致富。

sentences.english: Silkworm germplasm resources are the bases to develop sericulture.
sentences.chinese: 家蠶種質資源是改進養蠶業和絲綢業的物質基礎。

sentences.english: When she returned home, she began to raise silkworms and taught her neighbours how to do it.
sentences.chinese: 當阿巧回家後，她開始養蠶，並教她的鄰居如何養蠶。

sentences.english: When she returned home, she began to raise silkworms and taught her neighbours how to do it.
sentences.chinese: 當阿巧回家後，她開始養蠶，並教她的鄰居如何養蠶。

sentences.english: The silkworm rearing of Shansang variety were contrasted with biological determination.
sentences.chinese: 通過生物鑑定方式對陝桑系列桑品種進行養蠶對比。

sentences.english: She visited silk farms and taught herself clothes-dying processes.
sentences.chinese: 她還去過養蠶場，自學了織物染色方法。

sentences.english: Eg. They increased their income by raising silkworms and so on.
sentences.chinese: 他們靠養蠶等增加了收入。

definition: Kuanmiao township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to break out of an eggshell/to molt/to remove the husk/to shell
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
our peasant friends (political term used in the early years of the Old Democratic Revolution, 1840-1919)/(Tw) (coll.) farmer
